intro: Palafoxia hookeriana, commonly known as Hooker's palafoxia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Palafoxia hookeriana is often found in dry, disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
